2. City Council

City Council
============

The City of Cedar Hill is a home rule city with a council-manager form of government. Under this form of government, the elected City Council sets the policies for the city's operation. The administrative responsibility of the city rests with the City Manager who is appointed by the City Council.

![Final Retouched Group Deck Photo - Cropped](https://cedarhilltx.com/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=43563)

The City Council consists of 7 members - 1 Mayor, and 6 Council members.  The current members of the City Council are:

* [Mayor Stephen Mason](http://cedarhilltx.com/2518/Mayor-Stephen-Mason)
* [Gregory Glover, Mayor Pro Tem](http://cedarhilltx.com/2541/Gregory-Glover)
* [Gerald L. Malone, Council Member](https://www.cedarhilltx.com/2529/Gerald-L-Malone)
* [Daniel C. Haydin Jr. Council Member](https://www.cedarhilltx.com/279/Daniel-C-Haydin-Jr)
* [Alan E. Sims, Council Member](http://tx-cedarhill3.civicplus.com/2528/Alan-E-Sims)
* [Chad A. McCurdy, Council Member](https://cedarhilltx.com/2391/Chad-A-McCurdy)
* [Maranda K. Auzenne, Council Member](https://cedarhilltx.com/283/Maranda-Auzenne)

You can email the Mayor and individual City Council members  by clicking on the links above.   If you would like to send an email to
of the City Council, please send your email to the
[City Secretary](mailto:belinda.berg@cedarhilltx.com)
.

To leave a phone message for a City Council member, please dial (972) 291-5100, extension 1011.   To leave a phone message for the Mayor, please dial (972) 291-5100, extension 1012.

A proclamation is an official document issued by the Mayor to honor and celebrate special events, acknowledge significant issues, or raise awareness of programs and people that are a part of Cedar Hill's distinctive character.

Proclamation requests should be from a City of Cedar Hill resident or an organization based in Cedar Hill.   Requests should be made
2 weeks before the proclamation will be presented or picked up.

The requestor should provide proposed text for the proclamation in the form below, and the City may edit proposed text to reflect the City's vision, mission, and values.

After your request is received, the City will contact you at the phone number or email address provided with any questions or to confirm your proclamation request has been approved.
